item.description:
This was one of the first meet ups I attended with Christine, Stephanie, Linda and Marissa. It was an awesome and not too hard of a hike. I think a perfect Sunday morning hike.

Jack, Bella and I would like to do it again and we welcome anyone to join us.

The parking area is a little hard to find so follow the directions carefully. Bring bug spray, water, a snack, and poop bags. Hope to see you there. WOOF


DIRECTIONS The entrance to Pulpit Rock trail is on New Boston Rd.
It is approx 3.5 miles past the intersection of Wallace/New Boston rd on the left, just after Esther Rd.

Coming from Manchester start slowing down when you pass Pulpit Rd on your right. Esther Drive will be about 500' after on the left and the next left after that is the entrance to the parking area. The sign is made of wood and surrounded with green growth? easy to miss.

If you pass the Town Marker of New Bedford? you've gone too far!!
item.how_to_find_us: Tan Chevy Tracker. "WOOF" sticker on back.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Pulpit Rock Conservation Area.
